etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in Journal of the Chemical Society. From phorone + -ic, after French phoronique

definitions: "phoronic acid", a crystalline acid obtained by oxidizing camphoric acid; 2,6-dimethylheptan-4-one-2,6-dicarboxylic acid, HOOCC(CH₃)₂ CH₂ COCH₂ C(CH₃)₂ COOH.
